Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 443112: Radio, Television, and Other Electronics Stores
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Private Litigation Case Title: Tim Campbell v. Best Buy Stores, L.P. et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/750492/best-buy-wins-ok-for-deal-to-end-techs-unpaid-wages-suit

Private Litigation Case Title: Jones et al v. Best Buy Co., Inc. et al
Info Source: https://dockets.justia.com/docket/minnesota/mndce/0:2012cv00095/124152  (Settlement information is in PACER docket.)

Private Litigation Case Title: Turner v. Best Buy Co., Inc.
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/148162/best-buy-settles-ot-suit-over-worker-security-checks

Private Litigation Case Title: Kurihara v. Best Buy Co., Inc.
Info Source: https://www.plainsite.org/dockets/i7a70g48/california-northern-district-court/kurihara-v-best-buy-co-inc/ (Settlement information is in PACER docket.)

Description: Racial and gender discrimiknation. Most of the provisions of the settlement and consent decree involve changes in the company's hiring and promotion practices. The named plaintiffs were awarded $200,000 while the company agreed to pay $9,999,999 in legal fees and costs.
Private Litigation Case Title: Holloway et al v. Best Buy Co., Inc.
Info Source: https://www.clearinghouse.net/detail.php?id=10712&search=source%7Cgeneral%3BcaseName%7Cholloway%3Borderby%7CfilingYear%3B

Description: Bertelsmann Music Group Inc., EMI Music Distribution, Warner-Elektra-Atlantic Corporation, Sony Music Entertainment Inc., Universal Music Group, and retailers Trans World Entertainment Corporation, Tower Records, and Musicland Stores Corp jointly paid $143 million ($67.4 million cash and $75.5 million in CDs) to settle multistate antitrust allegations that they engaged in illegal agreements to establish artificially high minimum prices for prerecorded music in a move to stop discount stores from offering the products at lower prices. According to the final court order each company's share of the total settlement was as follows: Bertelsmann ($27.775 million), EMI ($15 million), Warner-Elektra-Atlantic ($29.4 million), Sony ($27.225 million), Universal ($40.6 million), Trans World ($800,000), Tower Records ($275,000) and Musicland ($2 million). The settlement was originally announced in September 2002; see https://ag.ny.gov/press-release/new-york-settles-price-fixing-case-against-major-distributors-compact-discs
Private Litigation Case Title: In re Compact Disc Minimum Advertised Price Antitrust Litigation
Info Source: http://app3.naag.org/antitrust/search/viewCivilLitigation.php?trans_id=191

Company: Best Buy Stores, L.P. and Household Insurance Group, Inc.
Description: Best Buy Stores and Household Insurance Group agreed to pay a $250,000 civil penalty plus restitution in settlement of allegations they sold Credit Insurance to customers in the state, that it was not always made clear to customers the policy they were buying, and that policies failed to have the disclosures or records required by the state.
Info Source: https://www.cards.commerce.state.mn.us/CARDS/security/search.do?documentId={25F71184-9A87-417C-BD35-29D5FAFCFDBD}
https://www.countyofsb.org/da/msm_county/documents/PeoplevBestBuyStoresLPRiversideCountySuperiorCourtCaseNoCVRI2000477.pdf
